intro: Matelea marginata, commonly known as the Mexican candleplant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange with red veins, and its hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Matelea marginata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
